article.title: Coprophagia

link.part: A female Oriental latrine fly (''Chrysomya megacephala'') feeds on animal feces.

article.paragraph: CoprophagiaIPAc-enkɒp.rə.ˈfeɪ.dʒi.əCoprophagia.(2012). Dictionary.com September 2, 2012, fromlinkorcoprophagyIPAc-enkəˈprɒfədʒiːis the consumption offeces. The word is derived from theGreek languageGreekcopros, "feces" andphagein, "to eat".Coprophagyrefers to many kinds of feces eating, including eating feces of other species (heterospecifics), of other individuals (allocoprophagy), or its own (autocoprophagy) those once deposited or taken directly from theanus.cite journalHirakawaH2001Coprophagy in leporids and other mammalian herbivoresMammal Review31161–80http://www.ingentaconnect.com/content/bsc/mam/2001/00000031/00000001/art0000510.1046/j.1365-2907.2001.00079.x

In humans, coprophagia has been observed in individuals with mental illness. Some animalspecieseat feces as a normal behavior; other species mayList of abnormal behaviours in animalsnot normallyconsume feces but do so under very unusual conditions.
article.heading: Humans
article.paragraph: Coprophagia has been observed in individuals withschizophreniacite journalHarada KI, Yamamoto K, Saito T.Effective treatment of coprophagia in a patient with schizophrenia with the novel atypical antipsychotic drug perospironePharmacopsychiatry200639311310.1055/s-2006-94148716721701andPica (disorder)pica.cite journalRose, E.A., Porcerelli, J.H., & Neale, A.V.Pica: Common but commonly missedThe Journal of the American Board of Family Practice2000135353–35811001006

Consuming feces carries the risk of contracting diseases and bacteria spread such asEscherichia coliE. coli,Hepatitis A,Hepatitis E,pneumonia,polio, andinfluenza. Coprophagia also carries a risk of contractingintestinal parasites.mcnFebruary 2015
article.heading: Other animals
Invertebrates
article.paragraph: Image:Common Blue butterflies.jpgthumbrightTwoCommon Bluecommon blueButterflybutterflieslap at a small lump of feces lying on a rock.Image:Physiphora alceae female.jpgthumbA female fly feeding on fecesCoprophagous insects consume anddigestionredigestthe feces of large animals. These feces contain substantial amounts of semi-digestedfood(herbivores'Gastrointestinal tractdigestive systemsare especially inefficient). Two feces-eating insects are thedung-beetleand thefly.

Termiteseat one another's feces as a means of obtaining theirhindgutprotists. Termites and protists have asymbioticrelationship (e.g. with the protozoan that allows the termites to digest the cellulose in their diet via the protists. For example, in one group of termites, there is a three-way symbiotic relationship - termites of the family Rhinotermitidae, cellulolytic protists of the genusPseudotrichonymphain the guts of these termites, and intracellular bacterial symbionts of the protists.cite journalCospeciation in the triplex symbiosis of termite gut protists (Pseudotrichonympha spp.), their hosts, and their bacterial endosymbionts.Noda, S., Kitade, O., Inoue, T., Kawai, M., Kanuka, M., Hiroshima, K., Hongoh, Y., Constantino, R., Uys, V., Zhong, J., Kudo, T. and Ohkuma, M.Molecular Ecology16620071257-1266http://www.unboundmedicine.com/medline/citation/17391411/Cospeciation_in_the_triplex_symbiosis_of_termite_gut_protists__Pseudotrichonympha_spp___their_hosts_and_their_bacterial_endosymbionts_
article.heading: Vertebrates
article.paragraph: Domesticated and wild mammals are known to consume feces. In the wild they either bury or eat waste to protect their trail from predators. Mothers of certain species are known to eat the feces of their newborn young during the earliest phase after birth, presumably to eliminate cues to potential predators and to keep the den clean.cnJanuary 2015

Rabbitsreingest their own droppings (rather thanRuminantchewing the cudas do cows and many other herbivores) to digest their food and extract sufficient nutrients. Chewed plant material collects in a chamber between the large and small intestine containing large quantities of symbiotic bacteria that help with the digestion of cellulose and also produce certain B vitamins. After being excreted, they are eaten whole by the rabbit and redigested in a special part of the stomach. The pellets remain intact for up to six hours in the stomach; the bacteria within continue to digest the plant carbohydrates. This double-digestion process enables rabbits to use nutrients that they may have missed during the first passage through the gut, as well as the nutrients formed by the microbial activity and thus ensures that maximum nutrition is derived from the food they eat.cite encyclopediarabbit[[Encyclopædia Britannica]][[Encyclopædia Britannica, Inc.]]ChicagoStandard2007This process serves the same purpose within the rabbit asruminantruminationdoes in cattle and sheep.The Private Life of the Rabbit, R. M. Lockley, 1964. Chapter 10.

Cattlein the United States are often fedchicken litter. There are concerns that the practice of feeding chicken litter to cattle could lead tobovine spongiform encephalopathy(mad-cow disease) because of the crushedmeat and bone mealbone mealin chicken feed. The U.S.Food and Drug Administrationregulates this practice by attempting to prevent the introduction of any part of a cow's brain or spinal cord intolivestockfeed.FDA Urged to Ban Feeding Chicken Litter to Cattle, 2009-11-02, L.A. TimesOther countries, like Canada, have banned chicken litter for use as a livestock feed.cite webhttp://www.inspection.gc.ca/animals/feeds/regulatory-guidance/rg-2/eng/1328859106165/1328859287377Canadian Food Inspection AgencyFeeding of Poultry Manure to Cattle Prohibited

The young ofelephants,Giant Pandagiant pandas,koalas, andHippopotamushipposeat the feces of their mothers or other animals in the herd to obtain thebacteriarequired to properly digestvegetationfound on their ecosystems.cite webhttp://www.bbc.co.uk/nature/adaptations/CoprophagiaBBC Nature — Dung eater videos, news and factsBbc.co.uk2011-11-27When they are born, theirintestinesdo not contain these bacteria, they are sterile. Without them, they would be unable to obtain any nutritional value from plants.

Hamsters,guinea pigs,chinchillasandnaked mole-rateat their own droppings, which are thought to be a source ofvitaminsB vitaminsBandVitamin KK, produced by gut bacteria.cnJanuary 2015Gorillasandchimpanzeeseat their own feces and the feces of other gorillas and chimpanzees. This may serve to improve absorption of vitamins or of nutritive elements made available from the re-ingestion of seeds.cite webhttp://pages.nycep.org/rothman/6PWUnutr.pdfNutritional Aspects of the Diet of Wild Gorillas2013-06-29

Pigssometimes eat the feces of herbivores that leave a significant amount of semi-digested matter, including their own. In some cultures, it was common for poor families to collect horse feces to feed their pigs, which contributes to the risk of parasite infection.cnJanuary 2015
article.heading: Plants
article.paragraph: Some carnivorous plants, such as pitcher plants of the genusNepenthes, obtain nourishment from the feces ofcommensalismcommensalanimals.cnJanuary 2015
article.heading: History
article.paragraph: Lewin reported that "... consumption of fresh, warmcamelfeces has been recommended byBedouinsas a remedy for bacterialdysentery; its efficacy (probably attributable to the antibioticsubtilisinfromBacillus subtilis) was anecdotally confirmed by German soldiers in Africa during World War II".cite journalLewin, Ralph A.More on merdePerspectives in Biology and Medicine2001444594–60710.1353/pbm.2001.006711600805
Centuries ago, physicians tasted their patients' feces, to better judge their state and condition.notes toThe Works of Francis Rabelais, Volume II, Volume 2, p. 56
article.heading: Society and culture
article.paragraph: Coprophagia is depicted inpornography, usually under the termscat(fromscatology).cite bookHolmesRonald M.Sex Crimes: Patterns and BehaviorSage PublicationsThousand Oaks0-7619-2417-547893709244

The 120 Days of Sodom, a novel by theMarquis de Sadewritten in 1785, is replete with detailed descriptions of erotic sadomasochistic coprophagia.le Marquis de Sade (1785) Les 120 journes de Sodome, ou L'cole du LibertinageThomas Pynchon's award winning 1973 novelGravity's Rainbowcontains a detailed scene of coprophagia.Thomas Pynchon (1973)Gravity's Rainbow, Part 2, episode 4.Franois Rabelais, in his classicGargantua and Pantagruel, often employs the expressionmche-merdeormchemerde, meaningshit-chewer. It is in turn a citation of the Greek comediansAristophanesand particularlyMenander, who often use the term skatophagos ().Rabelais, Book 1, ch. 40 and Book 3 chap. 25In one dialogue, Rabelais speaks of coprophagia as aChristiangesture, saying that monksswallow the shit of the world, that is the sins, and for this they are ostracized by society.Rabelais, Book 1, ch. 40 quote: "ilz mangent la merde du monde, c'est dire, les pechez"
